narrative=Rosemary Wright was last seen leaving her Home in Gleneagles. Her vehicle was found abandoned near a swamp, after losing contact with friend Geraldine while hiking.

narrative=Rosemary Wright was reported missing after failing to arrive at a planned meet-up with colleague Rhys Evans. She was last seen in a border area near a desert route. Despite initial searches, little was found until police traced her at a nearby location, safe and sound, several days later.

narrative=Rosemary Wright, a chartered certified accountant, was reported missing after failing to return from a hiking trip near a military base in Gleneagles, Auchterarder. It was suspected that she might have been a possible witness to a crime, as individuals had been reported acting suspiciously in the area where her son last received a call from her. The search extended to nearby volunteer organizations, and there were initial concerns about her being lost in the terrain given its complexity. Rosemary was eventually traced by staff to an address on Newtonmore Road, Kingussie, safe and unharmed, yet she remained quiet about the time spent missing.
narrative=Rosemary Wright, a possible witness to a crime, went missing after visiting a volunteer organization near a swamp. Her sister later joined the search.

narrative=Rosemary Wright, also known as MP, was reported missing from her home in Gleneagles. Prior to her disappearance, she had expressed interest in exploring remote areas, specifically mentioning a fascination with both the desert and swamp landscapes. On the day she went missing, she was last known to have visited a local hospital for a routine check-up, but she never returned home. Her daughter, concerned by her absence, contacted authorities when MP failed to arrive at an arranged meeting. Among the theories considered, it was postulated that MP might have embarked on an unplanned journey to one of the nearby swamps, known for its isolated trails. After extensive searches through these remote areas, particularly focusing on stretches surrounding hospital routes, police successfully located Rosemary three days later, unharmed and taking photographs of obscure desert plant life.

narrative=Rosemary Wright was last seen leaving her home in Gleneagles, often taking walks to clear her mind. She regularly visited areas near the border, including a stretch of desert terrain she found tranquil. Rosemary's sister became concerned when she failed to return home or answer any calls. Lacking communication, the sister contacted Joanne, a close friend, who confirmed Rosemary often enjoyed solitude in these remote spots. Concern grew as time passed, prompting the family to alert authorities. Later, a member of the public recognized Rosemary on Newtonmore Road in Kingussie and notified local authorities, ensuring her safe return. She was found unharmed but disoriented.
narrative=Rosemary Wright was last seen speaking to Joanne near Moray Street, Blackford, PH4 1QF, before vanishing.

narrative=Rosemary Wright was last seen leaving her home on Gleneagles, Auchterarder, PH3 1NZ. Her vehicle was later found abandoned near a military base close to Moray Street, Blackford, PH4 1QF. Evidence suggested she may have decided to hike through the region, possibly becoming disoriented in the nearby swamp area. During the investigation, clues led to a hospital-related location on Saint Mary's Road, Birnam, PH8 0BJ. Police efforts eventually traced her to safety, concluding her disappearance.
